collection_readme.name: README.md
collection_readme.html:
netapp.elementSW

NetApp ElementSW Collection

Copyright (c) 2019 NetApp, Inc. All rights reserved.
Specifications subject to change without notice.

Installation

ansible-galaxy collection install netapp.elementsw

To use Collection add the following to the top of your playbook, with out this you will be using Ansible 2.9 version of the module

collections:
  - netapp.elementsw

Need help

Join our Slack Channel at Netapp.io

Release Notes

20.2.0

Bug Fixes

  • galaxy.yml: fix path to github repository.
  • netapp.py: report error in case of connection error rather than raising a generic exception by default.

20.1.0

New Module

  • na_elementsw_access_group_volumes: add/remove volumes to/from existing access group

19.11.0

19.10.0

Changes in 19.10.0 and September collection releases compared to Ansible 2.9

Documentation Fixes:

  • na_elementsw_drive: na_elementsw_drive was documented as na_element_drive

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create, destroy, or update admin users on SolidFire
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: acceptEula
description: Boolean, true for accepting Eula, False Eula

options.name: access
description: A list of type the admin has access to

options.name: element_password
description: The password for the new admin account. Setting the password attribute will always reset your password, even if the password is the same

options.name: element_username
description: Unique username for this account. (May be 1 to 64 characters in length).

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified account should exist or not.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'
doc.short_description: NetApp Element Software Manage Admin Users

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Add admin user
      na_elementsw_admin_users:
        state: present
        username: "{{ admin_user_name }}"
        password: "{{ admin_password }}"
        hostname: "{{ hostname }}"
        element_username: carchi8py
        element_password: carchi8py
        acceptEula: True
        access: accounts,drives

    - name: modify admin user
      na_elementsw_admin_users:
        state: present
        username: "{{ admin_user_name }}"
        password: "{{ admin_password }}"
        hostname: "{{ hostname }}"
        element_username: carchi8py
        element_password: carchi8py12
        acceptEula: True
        access: accounts,drives,nodes

    - name: delete admin user
      na_elementsw_admin_users:
        state: absent
        username: "{{ admin_user_name }}"
        password: "{{ admin_password }}"
        hostname: "{{ hostname }}"
        element_username: carchi8py

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Configure Element SW Node Network Interfaces for Bond 1G and 10G IP address.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: bond_mode_10g
description: Bond mode for 10GbE configuration.

options.name: bond_mode_1g
description: Bond mode for 1GbE configuration.

options.name: dns_nameservers
description: List of addresses for domain name servers.

options.name: dns_search_domains
description: List of DNS search domains.

options.name: gateway_address_10g
description: Router network address to send packets out of the local network.

options.name: gateway_address_1g
description: Router network address to send packets out of the local network.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: ip_address_10g
description: IP address for the 10G network.

options.name: ip_address_1g
description: IP address for the 1G network.

options.name: lacp_10g
description: Link Aggregation Control Protocol useful only if LACP is selected as the Bond Mode.
Slow - Packets are transmitted at 30 second intervals.
Fast - Packets are transmitted in 1 second intervals.

options.name: lacp_1g
description: Link Aggregation Control Protocol useful only if LACP is selected as the Bond Mode.
Slow - Packets are transmitted at 30 second intervals.
Fast - Packets are transmitted in 1 second intervals.

options.name: method
description: Type of Method used to configure the interface.
method depends on other settings such as the use of a static IP address, which will change the method to static.
loopback - Used to define the IPv4 loopback interface.
manual - Used to define interfaces for which no configuration is done by default.
dhcp - May be used to obtain an IP address via DHCP.
static - Used to define Ethernet interfaces with statically allocated IPv4 addresses.

options.name: mtu_10g
description: Maximum Transmission Unit for 10GbE, Largest packet size that a network protocol can transmit.
Must be greater than or equal to 1500 bytes.

options.name: mtu_1g
description: Maximum Transmission Unit for 1GbE, Largest packet size that a network protocol can transmit.
Must be greater than or equal to 1500 bytes.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: subnet_10g
description: 10GbE Subnet Mask.

options.name: subnet_1g
description: 1GbE Subnet Mask.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

options.name: virtual_network_tag
description: This is the primary network tag. All nodes in a cluster have the same VLAN tag.

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'
doc.short_description: NetApp Element Software Configure Node Network Interfaces

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Set Node network interfaces configuration for Bond 1G and 10G properties
    tags:
    - elementsw_network_interfaces
    na_elementsw_network_interfaces:
      hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
      username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
      password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
      method: static
      ip_address_1g: 10.226.109.68
      ip_address_10g: 10.226.201.72
      subnet_1g: 255.255.255.0
      subnet_10g: 255.255.255.0
      gateway_address_1g: 10.193.139.1
      gateway_address_10g: 10.193.140.1
      mtu_1g: 1500
      mtu_10g: 9000
      bond_mode_1g: ActivePassive
      bond_mode_10g: LACP
      lacp_10g: Fast

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create backup
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: dest_hostname
description: hostname for the backup source cluster
will be set equal to hostname if not specified

options.name: dest_password
description: password for the backup destination cluster
will be set equal to password if not specified

options.name: dest_username
description: username for the backup destination cluster
will be set equal to username if not specified

options.name: dest_volume_id
description: ID of the backup destination volume

options.name: format
description: Backup format to use

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: script
description: the backup script to be executed

options.name: script_parameters
description: the backup script parameters

options.name: src_volume_id
description: ID of the backup source volume.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'

doc_strings.examples:
na_elementsw_backup:
  hostname: "{{ source_cluster_hostname }}"
  username: "{{ source_cluster_username }}"
  password: "{{ source_cluster_password }}"
  src_volume_id: 1
  dest_hostname: "{{ destination_cluster_hostname }}"
  dest_username: "{{ destination_cluster_username }}"
  dest_password: "{{ destination_cluster_password }}"
  dest_volume_id: 3
  format: native

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Element OS Cluster restore snapshot to volume.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: account_id
description: Account ID or Name of Parent/Source Volume.

options.name: dest_volume_name
description: New Name of destination for restoring the snapshot

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: src_snapshot_id
description: ID or Name of an existing snapshot.

options.name: src_volume_id
description: ID or Name of source active volume.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Restore snapshot to volume
     tags:
     - elementsw_create_snapshot_restore
     na_elementsw_snapshot_restore:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       account_id: ansible-1
       src_snapshot_id: snapshot_20171021
       src_volume_id: volume-playarea
       dest_volume_name: dest-volume-area

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create, destroy, or update accounts on Element SW
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: attributes
options.description: List of Name/Value pairs in JSON object format.

options.name: element_username
description: Unique username for this account. (May be 1 to 64 characters in length).

options.name: from_name
description: ID or Name of the account to rename.
Required to create an account called 'element_username' by renaming 'from_name'.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: initiator_secret
description: CHAP secret to use for the initiator. Should be 12-16 characters long and impenetrable.
The CHAP initiator secrets must be unique and cannot be the same as the target CHAP secret.
If not specified, a random secret is created.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified account should exist or not.

options.name: status
description: Status of the account.

options.name: target_secret
description: CHAP secret to use for the target (mutual CHAP authentication).
Should be 12-16 characters long and impenetrable.
The CHAP target secrets must be unique and cannot be the same as the initiator CHAP secret.
If not specified, a random secret is created.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create Account
  na_elementsw_account:
    hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
    username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
    password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
    state: present
    element_username: TenantA

- name: Modify Account
  na_elementsw_account:
    hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
    username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
    password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
    state: present
    status: locked
    element_username: TenantA

- name: Rename Account
  na_elementsw_account:
    hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
    username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
    password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
    state: present
    element_username: TenantA_Renamed
    from_name: TenantA

- name: Rename and modify Account
  na_elementsw_account:
    hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
    username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
    password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
    state: present
    status: locked
    element_username: TenantA_Renamed
    from_name: TenantA

- name: Delete Account
  na_elementsw_account:
    hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
    username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
    password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
    state: absent
    element_username: TenantA_Renamed

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Add, Erase or Remove drive for nodes on Element Software Cluster.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: drive_id
description: Drive ID or Serial Name of Node drive.
If not specified, add and remove action will be performed on all drives of node_id

options.name: force_during_bin_sync
description: Flag to force during a bin sync operation.

options.name: force_during_upgrade
description: Flag to force drive operation during upgrade.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: node_id
description: ID or Name of cluster node.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: state
description: Element SW Storage Drive operation state.
present - To add drive of node to participate in cluster data storage.
absent  - To remove the drive from being part of active cluster.
clean   - Clean-up any residual data persistent on a *removed* drive in a secured method.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'
doc.short_description: NetApp Element Software Manage Node Drives

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Add drive with status available to cluster
     tags:
     - elementsw_add_drive
     na_elementsw_drive:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       drive_id: scsi-SATA_SAMSUNG_MZ7LM48S2UJNX0J3221807
       force_during_upgrade: false
       force_during_bin_sync: false
       node_id: sf4805-meg-03

   - name: Remove active drive from cluster
     tags:
     - elementsw_remove_drive
     na_elementsw_drive:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: absent
       force_during_upgrade: false
       node_id: sf4805-meg-03
       drive_id: scsi-SATA_SAMSUNG_MZ7LM48S2UJNX0J321208

   - name: Secure Erase drive
     tags:
     - elemensw_clean_drive
     na_elementsw_drive:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: clean
       drive_id: scsi-SATA_SAMSUNG_MZ7LM48S2UJNX0J432109
       node_id: sf4805-meg-03

   - name: Add all the drives of a node to cluster
     tags:
     - elementsw_add_node
     na_elementsw_drive:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       force_during_upgrade: false
       force_during_bin_sync: false
       node_id: sf4805-meg-03

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Used to test the management connection to the cluster.
The test pings the MVIP and SVIP, and executes a simple API method to verify connectivity.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: mvip
description: Optionally, use to test connection of a different MVIP.
This is not needed to test the connection to the target cluster.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: skip
description: Skip checking connection to SVIP or MVIP.

options.name: svip
description: Optionally, use to test connection of a different SVIP.
This is not needed to test the connection to the target cluster.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'
doc.short_description: NetApp Element Software Check connectivity to MVIP and SVIP.

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Check connections to MVIP and SVIP
     na_elementsw_check_connections:
       hostname: "{{ solidfire_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ solidfire_username }}"
       password: "{{ solidfire_password }}"

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create volume clones on Element OS
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: access
description: Access allowed for the volume.
If unspecified, the access settings of the clone will be the same as the source.
readOnly - Only read operations are allowed.
readWrite - Reads and writes are allowed.
locked - No reads or writes are allowed.
replicationTarget - Identify a volume as the target volume for a paired set of volumes. If the volume is not paired, the access status is locked.

options.name: account_id
description: Account ID for the owner of this cloned volume. id may be a numeric identifier or an account name.

options.name: attributes
options.description: A YAML dictionary of attributes that you would like to apply on this cloned volume.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: name
description: The name of the clone.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: size
description: The size of the cloned volume in (size_unit).

options.name: size_unit
description: The unit used to interpret the size parameter.

options.name: src_snapshot_id
description: The id of the snapshot to clone. id may be a numeric identifier or a snapshot name.

options.name: src_volume_id
description: The id of the src volume to clone. id may be a numeric identifier or a volume name.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'
doc.short_description: NetApp Element Software Create Volume Clone

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Clone Volume
      na_elementsw_volume_clone:
        hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
        password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
        name: CloneAnsibleVol
        src_volume_id: 123
        src_snapshot_id: 41
        account_id: 3
        size: 1
        size_unit: gb
        access: readWrite
        attributes: {"virtual_network_id": 12345}

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Initialize Element Software node ownership to form a cluster.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: accept_eula
description: Required to indicate your acceptance of the End User License Agreement when creating this cluster.
To accept the EULA, set this parameter to true.

options.name: attributes
description: List of name-value pairs in JSON object format.

options.name: cluster_admin_password
description: Initial password for the cluster admin account.
If not provided, default to login password.

options.name: cluster_admin_username
description: Username for the cluster admin.
If not provided, default to login username.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: management_virtual_ip
description: Floating (virtual) IP address for the cluster on the management network.

options.name: nodes
description: Storage IP (SIP) addresses of the initial set of nodes making up the cluster.
nodes IP must be in the list.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: replica_count
description: Number of replicas of each piece of data to store in the cluster.

options.name: storage_virtual_ip
description: Floating (virtual) IP address for the cluster on the storage (iSCSI) network.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Initialize new cluster
    tags:
    - elementsw_cluster
    na_elementsw_cluster:
      hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
      username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
      password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
      management_virtual_ip: 10.226.108.32
      storage_virtual_ip: 10.226.109.68
      replica_count: 2
      accept_eula: true
      nodes:
      - 10.226.109.72
      - 10.226.109.74

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create, delete, modify VLAN
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: address_blocks
description: List of address blocks for the VLAN
Each address block contains the starting IP address and size for the block
Required for create

options.name: attributes
description: Dictionary of attributes with name and value for each attribute

options.name: gateway
description: Gateway for the VLAN

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: name
description: User defined name for the new VLAN
Name of the vlan is unique
Required for create

options.name: namespace
description: Enable or disable namespaces

options.name: netmask
description: Netmask for the VLAN
Required for create

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified vlan should exist or not.

options.name: svip
description: Storage virtual IP which is unique
Required for create

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

options.name: vlan_tag
description: Virtual Network Tag

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create vlan
  na_elementsw_vlan:
    state: present
    name: test
    vlan_tag: 1
    svip: "{{ ip address }}"
    netmask: "{{ netmask }}"
    address_blocks:
      - start: "{{ starting ip_address }}"
        size: 5
      - start: "{{ starting ip_address }}"
        size: 5
    hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
    username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
    password: "{{ netapp_password }}"

- name: Delete Lun
  na_elementsw_vlan:
    state: absent
    vlan_tag: 1
    hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
    username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
    password: "{{ netapp_password }}"

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Enable, disable ldap, and add ldap users
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: authType
description: Identifies which user authentication method to use.

options.name: groupSearchBaseDn
description: The base DN of the tree to start the group search (will do a subtree search from here)

options.name: groupSearchCustomFilter
description: For use with the CustomFilter Search type

options.name: groupSearchType
description: Controls the default group search filter used

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: searchBindDN
description: A dully qualified DN to log in with to perform an LDAp search for the user (needs read access to the LDAP directory).

options.name: searchBindPassword
description: The password for the searchBindDN account used for searching

options.name: serverURIs
description: A comma-separated list of LDAP server URIs

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified volume should exist or not.

options.name: userDNTemplate
description: A string that is used form a fully qualified user DN.

options.name: userSearchBaseDN
description: The base DN of the tree to start the search (will do a subtree search from here)

options.name: userSearchFilter
description: the LDAP Filter to use

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'
doc.short_description: NetApp Element Software Manage ldap admin users

doc_strings.examples:
- name: disable ldap authentication
      na_elementsw_ldap:
        state: absent
        username: "{{ admin username }}"
        password: "{{ admin password }}"
        hostname: "{{ hostname }}"

    - name: Enable ldap authentication
      na_elementsw_ldap:
        state: present
        username: "{{ admin username }}"
        password: "{{ admin password }}"
        hostname: "{{ hostname }}"
        authType: DirectBind
        serverURIs: ldap://svmdurlabesx01spd_ldapclnt
        groupSearchType: MemberDN
        userDNTemplate:  uid=%USERNAME%,cn=users,cn=accounts,dc=corp,dc="{{ company name }}",dc=com

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Configure Element Software cluster.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: enable_virtual_volumes
description: Enable the NetApp SolidFire VVols cluster feature

options.name: encryption_at_rest
description: enable or disable the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) 256-bit encryption at rest on the cluster

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: modify_cluster_full_threshold
description: The capacity level at which the cluster generates an event
Requires a stage3_block_threshold_percent or
max_metadata_over_provision_factor or
stage2_aware_threshold

suboptions.name: max_metadata_over_provision_factor
description: The number of times metadata space can be overprovisioned relative to the amount of space available

suboptions.name: stage2_aware_threshold
description: The number of nodes of capacity remaining in the cluster before the system triggers a notification

suboptions.name: stage3_block_threshold_percent
description: The percentage below the "Error" threshold that triggers a cluster "Warning" alert

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: set_ntp_info
description: configure NTP on cluster node
Requires a list of one or more ntp_servers

suboptions.name: broadcastclient
description: Enables every node in the cluster as a broadcast client

suboptions.name: ntp_servers
description: list of NTP servers to add to each nodes NTP configuration

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Configure cluster
    tags:
    - elementsw_cluster_config
    na_elementsw_cluster_config:
      hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
      username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
      password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
      modify_cluster_full_threshold:
        stage2_aware_threshold: 2
        stage3_block_threshold_percent: 10
        max_metadata_over_provision_factor: 2
      encryption_at_rest: absent
      set_ntp_info:
        broadcastclient: False
        ntp_servers:
        - 1.1.1.1
        - 2.2.2.2
      enable_virtual_volumes: True

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create, delete volume pair
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: dest_account
description: Destination account name or ID

options.name: dest_mvip
description: Destination IP address of the paired cluster.

options.name: dest_password
description: Destination password for the paired cluster
Optional if this is same as source cluster password.

options.name: dest_username
description: Destination username for the paired cluster
Optional if this is same as source cluster username.

options.name: dest_volume
description: Destination volume name or volume ID

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: mode
description: Mode to start the volume pairing

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: src_account
description: Source account name or ID

options.name: src_volume
description: Source volume name or volume ID

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified volume pair should exist or not.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create volume pair
     na_elementsw_volume_pair:
       hostname: "{{ src_cluster_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ src_cluster_username }}"
       password: "{{ src_cluster_password }}"
       state: present
       src_volume: test1
       src_account: test2
       dest_volume: test3
       dest_account: test4
       mode: sync
       dest_mvip: "{{ dest_cluster_hostname }}"

   - name: Delete volume pair
     na_elementsw_volume_pair:
       hostname: "{{ src_cluster_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ src_cluster_username }}"
       password: "{{ src_cluster_password }}"
       state: absent
       src_volume: 3
       src_account: 1
       dest_volume: 2
       dest_account: 1
       dest_mvip: "{{ dest_cluster_hostname }}"
       dest_username: "{{ dest_cluster_username }}"
       dest_password: "{{ dest_cluster_password }}"

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create, delete cluster pair
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: dest_mvip
description: Destination IP address of the cluster to be paired.

options.name: dest_password
description: Destination password for the cluster to be paired.
Optional if this is same as source cluster password.

options.name: dest_username
description: Destination username for the cluster to be paired.
Optional if this is same as source cluster username.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified cluster pair should exist or not.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'
doc.short_description: NetApp Element Software Manage Cluster Pair

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create cluster pair
     na_elementsw_cluster_pair:
       hostname: "{{ src_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ src_username }}"
       password: "{{ src_password }}"
       state: present
       dest_mvip: "{{ dest_hostname }}"

   - name: Delete cluster pair
     na_elementsw_cluster_pair:
       hostname: "{{ src_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ src_username }}"
       password: "{{ src_password }}"
       state: absent
       dest_mvip: "{{ dest_hostname }}"
       dest_username: "{{ dest_username }}"
       dest_password: "{{ dest_password }}"

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create, destroy, or update access groups on Element Software Cluster.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: account_id
description: Account ID for the owner of this volume.
It accepts either account_name or account_id
if account_id is digit, it will consider as account_id
If account_id is string, it will consider as account_name

options.name: attributes
options.description: List of Name/Value pairs in JSON object format.

options.name: from_name
description: ID or Name of the access group to rename.
Required to create a new access group called 'name' by renaming 'from_name'.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: initiators
description: List of initiators to include in the access group. If unspecified, the access group will start out without configured initiators.

options.name: name
description: Name for the access group for create, modify and delete operations.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified access group should exist or not.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

options.name: virtual_network_id
description: The ID of the Element SW Software Cluster Virtual Network ID to associate the access group with.

options.name: virtual_network_tags
description: The ID of the VLAN Virtual Network Tag to associate the access group with.

options.name: volumes
description: List of volumes to initially include in the volume access group. If unspecified, the access group will start without any volumes.
It accepts either volume_name or volume_id

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'
doc.short_description: NetApp Element Software Manage Access Groups

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create Access Group
     na_elementsw_access_group:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       name: AnsibleAccessGroup
       volumes: [7,8]
       account_id: 1

   - name: Modify Access Group
     na_elementsw_access_group:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       name: AnsibleAccessGroup-Renamed
       account_id: 1
       attributes: {"volumes": [1,2,3], "virtual_network_id": 12345}

   - name: Rename Access Group
     na_elementsw_access_group:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       from_name: AnsibleAccessGroup
       name: AnsibleAccessGroup-Renamed

   - name: Delete Access Group
     na_elementsw_access_group:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: absent
       name: 1

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Add, remove cluster node on Element Software Cluster.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: node_id
description: List of IDs or Names or IP Address of nodes from cluster used for operation.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: state
description: Element Software Storage Node operation state.
present - To add pending node to participate in cluster data storage.
absent  - To remove node from active cluster.  A node cannot be removed if active drives are present.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Add node from pending to active cluster
     tags:
     - elementsw_add_node
     na_elementsw_node:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       node_id: sf4805-meg-03

   - name: Remove active node from cluster
     tags:
     - elementsw_remove_node
     na_elementsw_node:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: absent
       node_id: 13

   - name: Add node from pending to active cluster using node IP
     tags:
     - elementsw_add_node_ip
     na_elementsw_node:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       node_id: 10.109.48.65

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create, destroy, or update accounts on ElementSW
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: account_id
description: Account ID for the owner of this volume.
It accepts either account_name or account_id
if account_id is digit, it will consider as account_id
If account_id is string, it will consider as account_name

options.name: days_of_month_monthdays
options.description: List of days of the month (1-31)

options.name: days_of_week_weekdays
options.description: List of days of the week (Sunday to Saturday)

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: name
description: Name for the snapshot schedule.
It accepts either schedule_id or schedule_name
if name is digit, it will consider as schedule_id
If name is string, it will consider as schedule_name

options.name: password
description: Element SW access account password

options.name: paused
description: Pause / Resume a schedule.

options.name: recurring
description: Should the schedule recur?

options.name: retention
description: Retention period for the snapshot.
Format is 'HH:mm:ss'.

options.name: schedule_type
description: Schedule type for creating schedule.

options.name: snapshot_name
description: Name for the created snapshots.

options.name: starting_date
description: Starting date for the schedule.
Required when C(state=present).

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified schedule should exist or not.

options.name: username
description: Element SW access account user-name

options.name: volumes
description: Volume IDs that you want to set the snapshot schedule for.
It accepts both volume_name and volume_id

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create Snapshot schedule
     na_elementsw_snapshot_schedule:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       name: Schedule_A
       schedule_type: TimeIntervalFrequency
       time_interval_days: 1
       starting_date: '2016-12-01T00:00:00Z'
       volumes:
       - 7
       - test
       account_id: 1

   - name: Update Snapshot schedule
     na_elementsw_snapshot_schedule:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       name: Schedule_A
       schedule_type: TimeIntervalFrequency
       time_interval_days: 1
       starting_date: '2016-12-01T00:00:00Z'
       volumes:
       - 8
       - test1
       account_id: 1

   - name: Delete Snapshot schedule
     na_elementsw_snapshot_schedule:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: absent
       name: 6

return.name: schedule_id
return.description: Schedule ID of the newly created schedule

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Add or remove volumes to/from access group on Element Software Cluster.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: access_group
description: Name or id for the access group to add volumes to, or remove volumes from

options.name: account_id
description: Account ID for the owner of this volume.
It accepts either account_name or account_id
if account_id is numeric, look up for account_id first, then look up for account_name
If account_id is not numeric, look up for account_name

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified volumes should exist or not for this access group.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

options.name: volumes
description: List of volumes to add/remove from/to the access group.
It accepts either volume_name or volume_id

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'
doc.short_description: NetApp Element Software Add/Remove Volumes to/from Access Group

doc_strings.examples:
- name:  Add Volumes to Access Group
     na_elementsw_access_group:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       access_group: AnsibleAccessGroup
       volumes: ['vol7','vol8','vol9']
       account_id: '1'

   - name:  Remove Volumes from Access Group
     na_elementsw_access_group:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: absent
       access_group: AnsibleAccessGroup
       volumes: ['vol7','vol9']
       account_id: '1'

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create, destroy, or update volumes on ElementSW
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: access
description: Access allowed for the volume.
readOnly           Only read operations are allowed.
readWrite          Reads and writes are allowed.
locked             No reads or writes are allowed.
replicationTarget  Identify a volume as the target volume for a paired set of volumes.
If the volume is not paired, the access status is locked.
If unspecified, the access settings of the clone will be the same as the source.

options.name: account_id
description: Account ID for the owner of this volume.
It accepts Account_id or Account_name

options.name: attributes
options.description: A YAML dictionary of attributes that you would like to apply on this volume.

options.name: enable512e
description: Required when C(state=present)
Should the volume provide 512-byte sector emulation?

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: name
description: The name of the volume to manage.
It accepts volume_name or volume_id

options.name: password
description: ElementSW access account password

options.name: qos
options.description: Initial quality of service settings for this volume. Configure as dict in playbooks.

options.name: size
description: The size of the volume in (size_unit).
Required when C(state = present).

options.name: size_unit
description: The unit used to interpret the size parameter.

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified volume should exist or not.

options.name: username
description: ElementSW access account user-name

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create Volume
     na_elementsw_volume:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       name: AnsibleVol
       qos: {minIOPS: 1000, maxIOPS: 20000, burstIOPS: 50000}
       account_id: 3
       enable512e: False
       size: 1
       size_unit: gb

   - name: Update Volume
     na_elementsw_volume:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       name: AnsibleVol
       account_id: 3
       access: readWrite

   - name: Delete Volume
     na_elementsw_volume:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: absent
       name: AnsibleVol
       account_id: 2

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create, Modify or Delete Snapshot on Element OS Cluster.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: account_id
description: Account ID or Name of Parent/Source Volume.

options.name: enable_remote_replication
description: Flag, whether to replicate the snapshot created to a remote replication cluster.
To enable specify 'true' value.

options.name: expiration_time
description: The date and time (format ISO 8601 date string) at which this snapshot will expire.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: name
description: Name of new snapshot create.
If unspecified, date and time when the snapshot was taken is used.

options.name: password
description: Element OS access account password

options.name: retention
description: Retention period for the snapshot.
Format is 'HH:mm:ss'.

options.name: snap_mirror_label
description: Label used by SnapMirror software to specify snapshot retention policy on SnapMirror endpoint.

options.name: src_snapshot_id
description: ID or Name of an existing snapshot.
Required when C(state=present), to modify snapshot properties.
Required when C(state=present), to create snapshot from another snapshot in the volume.
Required when C(state=absent), to delete snapshot.

options.name: src_volume_id
description: ID or Name of active volume.

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified snapshot should exist or not.

options.name: username
description: Element OS access account user-name

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create snapshot
     tags:
     - elementsw_create_snapshot
     na_elementsw_snapshot:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       src_volume_id: 118
       account_id: sagarsh
       name: newsnapshot-1

   - name: Modify Snapshot
     tags:
     - elementsw_modify_snapshot
     na_elementsw_snapshot:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: present
       src_volume_id: sagarshansivolume
       src_snapshot_id: test1
       account_id: sagarsh
       expiration_time: '2018-06-16T12:24:56Z'
       enable_remote_replication: false

   - name: Delete Snapshot
     tags:
     - elementsw_delete_snapshot
     na_elementsw_snapshot:
       hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
       username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
       password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
       state: absent
       src_snapshot_id: deltest1
       account_id: sagarsh
       src_volume_id: sagarshansivolume

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Configure Element Software cluster SNMP.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: networks
description: List of networks and what type of access they have to the SNMP servers running on the cluster nodes.
This parameter is required if SNMP v3 is disabled.

suboptions.name: access
description: ro for read-only access.
rw for read-write access.
rosys for read-only access to a restricted set of system information.

suboptions.name: cidr
description: A CIDR network mask. This network mask must be an integer greater than or equal to 0,                   and less than or equal to 32. It must also not be equal to 31.

suboptions.name: community
description: SNMP community string.

suboptions.name: network
description: This parameter along with the cidr variable is used to control which network the access and                   community string apply to.
The special value of 'default' is used to specify an entry that applies to all networks.
The cidr mask is ignored when network value is either a host name or default.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: snmp_v3_enabled
description: Which version of SNMP has to be enabled.

options.name: state
description: This module enables you to enable SNMP on cluster nodes. When you enable SNMP,           the action applies to all nodes in the cluster, and the values that are passed replace,           in whole, all values set in any previous call to this module.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

options.name: usm_users
description: List of users and the type of access they have to the SNMP servers running on the cluster nodes.
This parameter is required if SNMP v3 is enabled.

suboptions.name: access
description: rouser for read-only access.
rwuser for read-write access.
rosys for read-only access to a restricted set of system information.

suboptions.name: name
description: The name of the user. Must contain at least one character, but no more than 32 characters.
Blank spaces are not allowed.

suboptions.name: passphrase
description: The passphrase of the user. Must be between 8 and 255 characters long (inclusive).
Blank spaces are not allowed.
Required if 'secLevel' is 'priv.'

suboptions.name: password
description: The password of the user. Must be between 8 and 255 characters long (inclusive).
Blank spaces are not allowed.
Required if 'secLevel' is 'auth' or 'priv.'

suboptions.name: secLevel
description: To define the security level of a user.

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: configure SnmpNetwork
    tags:
    - elementsw_cluster_snmp
    na_elementsw_cluster_snmp:
      hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
      username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
      password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
      state: present
      snmp_v3_enabled: True
      usm_users:
        access: rouser
        name: testuser
        password: ChangeMe123
        passphrase: ChangeMe123
        secLevel: auth
      networks:
        access: ro
        cidr: 24
        community: TestNetwork
        network: 192.168.0.1

  - name: Disable SnmpNetwork
    tags:
    - elementsw_cluster_snmp
    na_elementsw_cluster_snmp:
      hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
      username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
      password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
      state: absent

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Manage Element Software initiators that allow external clients access to volumes.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_elementsw are built to support the SolidFire storage platform.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

options.name: initiators
options.description: A list of objects containing characteristics of each initiator.

suboptions.name: alias
suboptions.description: The friendly name assigned to this initiator.

suboptions.name: attributes
suboptions.description: A set of JSON attributes to assign to this initiator.

suboptions.name: initiator_id
suboptions.description: The numeric ID of the initiator.

suboptions.name: volume_access_groups
suboptions.description: A list of volumeAccessGroupIDs to which this initiator belongs.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified initiator should exist or not.

options.name: username
description: Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/documentation/docweb/index.html?productID=62636&language=en-US).

requirements: The modules were developed with SolidFire 10.1
solidfire-sdk-python (1.1.0.92) or greater. Install using 'pip install solidfire-sdk-python'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Manage initiators
    tags:
    - na_elementsw_initiators
    na_elementsw_initiators:
      hostname: "{{ elementsw_hostname }}"
      username: "{{ elementsw_username }}"
      password: "{{ elementsw_password }}"
      initiators:
      - name: a
        alias: a1
        initiator_id: 1
        volume_access_groups:
        - 1
        - 2
        attributes: {"key": "value"}
      - name: b
        alias: b2
        initiator_id: 2
        volume_access_groups:
        - 2
    state: present
